item.title: An introduction to using Hyperopt library
item.description: Hyperopt Basics This is an introduction to using Hyperopt library. This library is used to choose the hyperparameters, that is the parameters of the model that is chosen to estimate the data. For example, when you find your model by optimizing function \[ \frac{1}{N} \sum_{i=1}^N \left( y_i - \hat f (x_i) \right)^2 + \lambda R(f), \] then Î» is a hyperparameter that must be chosen before the optimization.
